alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 03 at 3:24AM MDT until May 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM THURSDAY FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN, CENTRAL, AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Increasing southwest flow aloft will spread very dry air over the region Thursday and Friday. Strong southwest winds, very low humidity, warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass will lead to several hours of critical fire weather conditions across parts of the region. In addition, lightning strikes from today and Tuesday over receptive fuel beds may lead to new ignitions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Thursday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), East Central Plains (Zone 126), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and Northeast Plains (104) from noon to 8 pm MDT Thursday then again Friday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph on Thursday and Friday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 14 percent on Thursday then 6 to 10 percent on Friday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
